headline: Chocolate Chip Cheese Ball
description: This chocolate chip cheese ball is a fun party offering with graham crackers or chocolate wafers. Smooth cream cheese contrasts nicely with chips and nuts.

video.description: It’s like a chocolate cheesecake without all the hard work!
video.name: Chocolate Chip Cheese Ball

name: Chocolate Chip Cheese Ball

recipeInstructions.text: Beat cream cheese and butter in a medium bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Mix in confectioners' sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla. Stir in chocolate chips. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
Shape chilled cream cheese mixture into a ball. Wrap with plastic wrap and return to the refrigerator for 1 hour.
When ready to serve, remove and discard the plastic wrap. Roll cheese ball in pecans and place onto a serving platter.

review.reviewBody: The only thing I add is crushed heath bar chips.
Super simple! I skipped the chocolate chips and nuts and used crushed Oreo cookies! Served with graham crackers and 'Nilla' Wafers. Yum.
We LOVE this cheese ball! We use Scooby Snacks Graham Crackers with it - SO GOOD!
My coworkers "hate" me after making this. I found it to be a little soft so I added a little more powdered sugar. And I omitted the nuts. Highly recommend this recipe.

Excellent. I used mini chips and added an extra 1/4 cup to the mix. Also added heath bar toffee chips about 1/4 cup. Served with vanilla wafers and whole strawberries. Made this for superbowl party to rave reviews.

This was such a hit at my halloween party everyone loved it. Followed recipe exactly as written other than the outside mini chocolate chips I added. I placed it in a plastic spider bowl and kinda formed the cream cheese ball to look like the spider
I made mine with Oreo crumbles in it and on it. An idea is to put a no-bake cheesecake crust around it
Have made this recipe several times over the past several years. It is always a hit! Many have requested the recipe, and certain friends request I bring this to gatherings.

Really good and really easy. We have a nut allergy in our house, so I left those out. I did not have a problem with it being too soft, but after reading those reviews I made it the night before so it would be nice and cold before forming. Served with teddy Grahams and pretzels.

I have made many similar cheeseballs and the folks saying it wouldn't form a ball- a couple of side notes. You have to use full fat cream cheese and real butter; softened but not melted. Increase the powdered sugar gradually, no more than 1/8c at a time, (if necessary), refrigerate tightly sealed overnight, then form a ball while mixture is very cold- do not allow it to sit before working with it. It will be sticky, roll ball on lightly powdered sugar surface. Then press chocolate chips or pecans. Refrigerate formed ball until serving. Allow a minimum of 1 hour after rolling and before serving to firm up nicely. Ball will not be as firm as a traditional cheeseball but will hold it's shape nicely.
I’ve made this numerous times. The first time I made it I didn’t see that the butter was soften and I melted it. It made a dip instead of a ball but it was still delicious no matter lol.

This is the type of dessert that people just cannot get enough of. So yummy and very easy to make. I followed the recipe exactly and served with graham crackers and slices of strawberries to top with. I will definitely be making this as my go-to dish to bring everywhere!
I made this and it was a hit!! I substituted nuts for sprinkles for someone with an allergy & served it with cinnamon “scooby snacks”
Delicious.... especially if you love sweet and chocolate! It’s also so simple a recipe you can imagine all sorts of variations.
Was delicious. Everyone loved it. Many asked for recipe. Just doubled vanilla.
too much butter. all I taste is butter. it's not bad, but I can't figure out what to eat it on because it's not as sweet as cheesecake but it's sweeter than a cheese wheel
Served it for a NYE treat. Got the chocolate Grahams as suggested but my friends couldn’t stop eating it with pretzel sticks. Definitely a keeper!

I used double the vanilla, otherwise no changes. It's delicious. Kudos to the one who thought up this one. I did use a food processor to make this and pulsed when I added the chocolate chips. I had Hershey Special Dark. Chips and with the pecan coating it will be sublime.
Delicious! Make sure to use miniature chips.
Rolled in colored candy sprinkles! Fun for any holiday! We like the Scooby dog bone graham crackers best.
Since I only had low-fat cream cheese, I served it in a pretty bowl as a dip & it was wonderful.
Delicious. Kids gobbled it up. I used the mini chips, but really didn’t care for that “chippy” texture.
It was a hit at my work food day. The only changed I made was using finely chopped pretzels instead of pecans due to peanut allergies.

I've made this several times according to the recipe and loved it. Our personal preference is to decrease the powdered sugar by 1/2 cup and add 1 additional tbsp of brown sugar. Either way it's always a hit!
Big hit at our family event! I coated the outside in toffee pieces and mini chips.

Froze at both stages to speed up. Did about 1/2 cup chocolate chips and 1/4 cup toffee. Could do more toffee. Used less than 1/2 cup softened butter because it’s what I had softened, probably a quarter). Must used naturally softened cream cheese and butter. No shortcuts. Dyed with 2 drop orange food coloring. 1 cup sugar. Served with graham crackers on pumpkin plate at Halloween party. Big hit.
Brought to a Halloween party and it made a big hit

Took this to my ladies' club meeting. It was devoured with gusto! They took the last of it off the counter and set it on the table so they could better scrape the plate. My changes were: About twice as much vanilla, a drop or two of almond extract in the first mixing step. I used sliced almonds instead of pecans because I couldn't find my pecans. I served it with sugar cookies instead of the graham crackers. 

Four stars because it was not as received as well at my mother's birthday party . It is very sweet, too sweet for me.
I made it for a graduation party and it was a big hit. I had people coming up to me asking for the recipe. I will definitely make it again!
This was easy to make and tasted delicious. I will make it again.

I made this for my book club and heard raves all night. My only modifications were 1) as I didn't have miniature chips I put the reg sized chips into a processor to grind some of them and 2) adding more chocolate using some chopped dark chocolate to probably come to a total of 1 cup. Put the cheese mixture onto a sheet of plastic wrap and fold the plastic over. When sealed, pat it into a ball. I chilled it for about 4-5 hours, and it firmed up nicely. Not sure it used as much as 3/4 cup pecans but put a good amount in a small bowl and patted the cheese ball into the nuts. I used Belvita chocolate breakfast wafers as I couldn't find regular chocolate wafers.

Big hit at bookclub! Took suggestion of another cook & added full cup of confectioners sugar, rolled in addtional mini chocolate chips with pecans & it was delicious! Served with chocolate graham crackers & vanilla wafers.

Big hit at my office holiday party! Only change I made was to crush together chocolate chips with both pecans and walnuts for the outer coating. Served with vanilla wafer cookies, chocolate graham crackers and miniature chocolate chop cookies.
Yummy
Yummy

This is a really great recipe, I love cheesecake and this reminds me of one. It's really sweet, I made it as it says, but I added a little more powdered sugar too. I'm not a fan of nuts of any kind, so I covered it with Heath toffee bits. My daughter found chocolate Graham crackers, which worked really well to compliment the taste, I think the thin chocolate wafers from the baking section would be good too.

This mixture wasn’t sweet enough for my taste so I added a little bit of regular sugar to knock out the tang of the cream cheese. Delicious! It was a huge hit at my party. I served it with pretzels and cream cheese.
Excellent!!!

I made this for Thanksgiving appetizers and it was really good. I made it according to directions and it came out great! I found "Nutmeg/Cinnamon" Triscuits. What a nice change from typical dishes....

Absolutely the best and everyone at the Christmas party I just went to loved it! Based on other reviews I did add more powdered sugar and another tablespoon of brown sugar. I rolled it in toffee bits...major yum! Thank you!
Easy and delish. I rolled mine in toffee bits. Yummy!!

I made this for my Book Club and they loved it. Since we were reading a book about South Africa, I served it with animal graham crackers. Several people asked for the recipe. It did make quite a large amount, so I had leftovers, which my husband and I HAD to eat! I did follow the recipe pretty closely, with excellent results.
So easy and delicious. I served it with dried apple chips, strawberries and graham crackers. It was a big hit!

I was looking for a new cheese ball recipe and came across this one. I plan on making this again. It was delicious--it really did taste like chocolate cheese cake. I made it according to the recipe. There was no problem forming it into a ball because it was refrigerated overnight.

I love cheesecake, so I was so excited to try this recipe. It was easy to make and it tasted just like cheesecake. I liked using chocolate Teddy Grahams to dip in it. It was a perfect dessert to make for my niece's graduation open house, as she is having a dessert bar...a cheesecake that looks like a cheese ball. Perfect!

Oh my this was good. I hadn't made a cheese ball before and was disappointed I couldn't get this to actually form a ball, but it was still tasty served in a bowl and taking out pieces to serve on chocolate wafers. I will try on tiny teddys too since I have leftovers and some teddys in the cupboard. I did find it a little sweet, but that helps me only eat a small portion and not devour it all at once. Certainly wouldn't up the sugar any more than is in the recipe. Will make again for sure :)

It's so much easier to just put this in a lidded container & scoop it out than it is to try to fool with making into a ball. And we don't bother with the nuts then. (Too many people don't care for nuts or are allergic) We serve it with graham cracker scooby snacks or vanilla wafers.

So yummy! I followed directions as written. After chilling for two hours, I dumped it onto saran wrap and molded it into a ball after wrapping it. This prevents your fingers from sticking to the cheese ball. After chilling for another hour, I placed and pressed the chopped pecans onto the ball. It was too awkward to roll it. There were no pecans on the bottom of the cheese ball but that did not affect the taste or popularity of this crowd-pleaser. Everyone loved it and asked for the recipe.
It didn’t set up in fridge, so I put it in the freezer in a bowl to set up a dome, everyone loved it!! This recipe is a keeper

I thought this was a very nice recipe for a pot luck although a bit too runny. Unfortunately, I forgot to take the advice provided by other reviewers to increase the amount of icing sugar to one cup. I think that would have helped. I would make it again however.
i was very good

This is a great dessert ball :) I did as others suggested and added an extra 1/2 cup of powdered sugar had no problem shaping it into a ball. I would suggest not adding extra chocolate chips as this makes it a bit difficult to spread. Letting it set in the fridge for a couple of days makes it better!
Kids and adults loved it. I took the advice of another reviewer and rolled it in semi sweet chocolate chips.
Made this for super bowl. It was a huge hit. I covered it in toffee bits and added more chocolate chips like another reviewer did. It was super yummy!
Looks good and held together well but didn’t go over with crowd. No one knew if it was a desert or an appetizer. Neither one fit this group.

I followed the recipe except for presentation (no ball). I served it with the cinnamon Triscuits (NO) and graham crackers. For a group I would use a variety of flavored graham crackers and vanilla wafers. It is like eating frosting. I have frozen the leftovers for another time. Since cream cheese freezes well, I figured this would free also.
Very easy to make. I used a cup of the confectioners' sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla. It made a lot so I divided it in half and made two. They were delicious and I would definitely make it again.
I placed it in the freezer and had no problems getting it to form a ball. Mini chips stayed on the outside nicely! Was delicious!!!

I followed the recipe as written....extremely easy to make.
This is definitely a "keeper"!!!
I would make this again. I received many compliments. I followed the recipe.

It came out bigger than needed. I bought some Nilla cookies and made sandwich cookies with the left over cheese ball. Everyone said they really liked it. Could have been more flavorful but that was probably my doing as a newbee. I also did not get miniature chocolate chips and the regular size chips were hard to chew. All in all I liked the recipe and will make it again! Thanks for entertaining my sweet tooth!
Very easy and delicious recipe! It is a bit rich. I almost doubled the recipe but, I'm glad I didn't since as written it made a fairly large ball. Took it to a Super bowl party and everyone love it.
Took to a Super Bowl party and it was a great hit!!

Made it for a Super Bowl party. It was a hit! I substituted the chopped pecans for Heath toffee bits. I separated it into 2 balls instead of 1 large one. Some had trouble getting it into a ball...I scooped it onto a piece of saran wrap and forced it into a ball, wrapped it and refrigerated it. Then when ready to serve, I just sprinkled it with toffee bits instead of trying to roll it. Served with cinnamon graham crackers.
This was great with chocolate graham crackers as well as salted honey wheat pretzels. I might try adding cinnamon next time.

I made this for a Bunko night gathering. All who tried it liked it. Then, the kids came back from the movies, asked if they could have some, whipped out bagels and made Chocolate Chip Cream Cheese bagels! We’ve decided to make the recipe but put the ‘ball’ in Tupperware for the kids to have for bagel breakfasts.
Very good. You can increase sugar or decrease butter as needed for consistency. Then add mix-ins. Big hit with kids.

I've been making this for years and it is always a hit! It is incredible spread on chocolate graham crackers. If you are dealing with nut allergies just serve it as a spread and don't cover it with pecans!

I found this recipe by accident several years ago and, since then, I don't think I would be allowed into a party without bringing it. I can't even count the number of times I have given out the recipe. i have only used chocolate toffee bits for coating, but I'm sure it's just as good with nuts. It is a very easy recipe, but not something that can be put together at the last minute. I usually try to make it a day ahead of time and let it set in the refrigerator overnight and I've never had a problem with it setting. Thanks for sharing the recipe!
This is so good! I made it for New Year's Eve and everyone enjoyed it. I will definitely make it again!
Great recipe. I made two of them and would suggest using 1 cup of confectioners sugar. Still a great recipe

Sinfully delicious and so incredibly easy!! Used Philly Cream Cheese, 1 stick salted butter and other ingredients as directed. Only change was to put all ingredients in the bowl at once and mixed all ingredients thoroughly once. Keeping the mixing to a minimum keeps the consistency firm to form a ball after chilling. I also chilled it in a round bowl lined with plastic wrap to keep the handling to a minimum. Wonderful treat.

My grandson doesn't like the ingredients in most cheese balls so I was looking for one he will like. I found it. This variation of a cheese ball is addictive to be some what sweet. I used the tiny chocolate chips and because he is allergic to nuts just rolled the outside in the tiny chips. I also have to admit the adults liked it as well. Try it.
I have made this quite a few times, but I don't make it in a ball, I use it in a dish as a dip with the chocolate graham crackers.
This was excellent! I had no trouble shaping it into a ball, by just using a large wooden spoon. Also, we preferred to use pretzel sticks to scoop it up with, 2 pretzel sticks being optimal.
I've made this several times, and follow the recipe exactly. It always steals the show at any event.
It was Easy to roll for us! I made three of them! We rolled it in Oreos instead of chocolate, it was wonderful!

Only substitute was adding chocolate cups to to outside instead of nuts. Was incredible. Although I used full fat cream cheese and followed the exact recipe, it never would form into a ball for me. No worries! Put it in a bowl, served with chocolate grahams and it was delicious!
Delicious dessert-cheese ball. Makes one large ball.
My co-workers loved it. I thought it was pretty good- think I'd definitely add the additional 1/4c of confectioner's sugar others mentioned as I'd have liked it a little firmer.
Went over big at party! Am doing again for Super Bowl.Easy!

Tried this recipe exactly as original, minus the pecan coating.
Divided the cheese ball into two plastic wrap coated small round bowls, refrigerated for a few hours. It was so easy to serve this by unwrapping the plastic wrap, turning it upside down on a platter. Dusted with dark cocoa powder and served with assorted crackers and sliced fruit. Tasted just like cheese cake. Nice to have a second cheese ball in the fridge for personal indulgence. Will probably make it again for Easter.
Loved it and so did all my friends. Will definitely make again!!!!
It was delisious!

Will definitely make again. Instead of rolling into a ball, I simply put into a cute bowl to chill. I was taking to a New Years Eve party and didn't know about possible nut allergies so I just sprinkled mini chocolate chips on top and omitted the nuts. Very yummy and people asked if I made it from some sort of purchased kit - nope! Simply and easy recipe from allrecipes.com
delicious. I added a bit of coffee flavor liquor. This makes quite a bit, enough for 3 cheese balls. One to keep and two to gift.
Definite winner! Easy to make and was delicious! Served with chocolate graham crackers.
I liked, but it was not so easy to cook:)
This cheese ball was so easy to make and is really yummy but it's really sweet. I paired with a graham crackers . My family loved it.
Holy cow!! So good!! Best with cinnamon graham crackers, but I'd also eat it off a spoon...or my finger. This was a New Years Eve party HIT!!!

I didn't roll the cheese ball in pecans (I was too lazy to chop them). But the ball was just as attractive and delicious without the nuts. And VERY popular with my guests! Loved it and will make it again for my next gathering!
I made this for New Year's Eve and it was a great hit! Everyone loved it. Super easy!

I made this exactly as stated and some liked it but for me, as one friend said, it was like eating frosting. I served with Ritz crackers. I would not make this again. Just put a tub of icing and put some nuts on it. I see this as having no redeeming value. Sorry!

i liked this because i love cream cheese. if you are having trouble forming it into a ball, serve it as a spread. works just fine that way. i wouldn't use anything light. i liked the chips but preferred it made with crushed heath bars. would not hesitate using milk chocolate chips at all. served mine with chocolate grahams and mini pretzels.
My granddaughter is very allergic to nuts. Any suggestions for rolling it in something else. When she is with us I made it and put in dip bowl without making it into a ball. Help.
I have been making this chocolate chip cheese ball for years now. It is an awesome appetizer. We serve it with ScoobyDoo crackers. In fact, I have to make 3 X the recipe. Good stuff.
Sounded good, and it was! the second time I made it, I added a touch of cayenne and it was terrific.
Have made this many times and is always a big hit Serve with chocolate graham crackers ...yum

Oh my word this is so yummy!!! I use plastic wrap to form it into a ball. I don't want to add any extra sugar because I like to taste as it is. I found forming it in the cling wrap helped it take shape without sticking too much. I've tried coating this with nuts, toffee bits, graham crumbs and mini chocolate chips - all delicious! Once it's mostly coated it's easy to adjust the shape into a more perfect ball.
